title.rendered: Minecraft: Microsoft launches Marketplace on Windows 10 and mobile devices

content.rendered:
With the new Discovery update (1.1), Microsoft is introducing the Marketplace in the Windows 10 and Mobile versions of Minecraft.

There you will find future new content curated and provided by the Minecraft team.

“With the new feature, players get another opportunity to make their creation available to the community for money. All transactions take place within the app, which offers players additional security and, for example, eliminates the risk of viruses/malware during installation. In addition to the Windows 10 and Pocket Edition, the Minecraft Marketplace is also planned for other platforms.

Players with “registered business” can sell content through the Marketplace. The new Minecraft Coins, which are bought with real money and can be paid out in real money, serve as currency.

300 coins will cost 1.99 euros, for 4.99 euros you get 840 coins and for 9.99 euros 1,720 coins. More information about the partner program can be found here.

The Discovery update is scheduled to be released in the spring, with a public beta planned for mid-April on Android.
